Issues.Title: Possible layout issues after Control.Defaultfont changes
Issues.Body:
**Problem description:**

As a result of the `Control.Defaultfont` changes introduced in #656 we *may* have a possible breaking experience for customer who had pixel-perfect layouts.

**Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->

| .NET 4.7.2 | .NET Core 3.0 |
|---|---|
| ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4403806/59082950-a6bba500-8938-11e9-8d07-cdae09a5e24b.png) |  ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4403806/59082924-8be93080-8938-11e9-8d98-11eea254bb1f.png) |

If you look closely with the new font we have a greater vertical space requirements.

I have also create a fixed layout test, and it displays a possible issue - some text may get clipped or covered:

| .NET 4.7.2 | .NET Core 3.0 |
|---|---|
| ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4403806/59083935-973e5b00-893c-11e9-9c12-395e830d1c60.png) | ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4403806/59083909-8261c780-893c-11e9-82ae-ae0476f1b417.png) |


**Expected behavior:**

Few options:
* We could note the new behaviour in release notes and be done with it.
* We could also add some sort of a switch or an opt-in behaviour that would allow customers to retain the original font. 
As discussed with @KlausLoeffelmann in https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/656#issuecomment-499839663 would could add `Application.SetDefaultFont(Font)` method to allow affected customers to set to which ever font works for them.

**Minimal repro:**

Run `WinformsControlsTest` and `WinFormsControlsClassicTests` and compare.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Possible layout issues after Control.Defaultfont changes" (#1113)

Issues.Title: PlaceholderText not virtual
Issues.Body:
While commenting #1109 I noticed that `TextBox.PlaceholderText` [is not virtual](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/src/System.Windows.Forms/src/System/Windows/Forms/TextBox.cs#L909). Is this intentional or an oversight? Other properties like `Text` are virtual, presumably to allow subclasses customization control. Making `PlaceholderText` not virtual means subclasses can't "turn off" this feature and are at the mercy of the caller not trying to set the property.

Might be worth fixing before 3.0 RTM if it is indeed an oversight.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "PlaceholderText not virtual" (#1110)

Issues.Title: FontNameEditor rendering artifact - *just* the blue box
Issues.Body:
<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->

**Problem description:**

`FontNameEditor` font preview is showing less characters.
For example on the below screenshots:

| Font | .NET 4.7.2 | .NET Core 3.0 |
|---|---|---|
| Arial Black | ab | a |
| Forte | abc | ab |
| Lucida Handwriting | ab | a |

**Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->

| .NET 4.7.2 | .NET Core 3.0 |
|---|---|
| ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4403806/59082950-a6bba500-8938-11e9-8d07-cdae09a5e24b.png) |  ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4403806/59082924-8be93080-8938-11e9-8d98-11eea254bb1f.png) |

🤔 ink It is possible the change may related to the change of the default font in #656.

**Expected behavior:**

We show the same amount of characters as with .NET FX.

It looks like we can achieve the same render by reducing the `fontSize` in `DrawFontSample`:
```
        private static void DrawFontSample(PaintValueEventArgs e, FontFamily fontFamily, FontStyle fontStyle)
        {
            float fontSize = (float)(e.Bounds.Height / 1.2);
            using (var font = new Font(fontFamily, fontSize, fontStyle, GraphicsUnit.Pixel))
            {
                e.Graphics.DrawString("abcd", font, SystemBrushes.ActiveCaptionText, e.Bounds);
            }
        }
```


**Minimal repro:**

* Run WinformsControlsTest in .NET 4.7.2 and .NET 3
* Compare
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "FontNameEditor rendering artifact - *just* the blue box" (#1106)

Issues.Title: allow integration tests to work with machine-wide installed dotnet sdk
Issues.Body:
- The integration tests were failing locally when there was no private sdk install (.dotnet folder) which happens when the version specified in the global.json is already installed machine-wide.
- This fixes the code to check for a private .dotnet install first, then look for a matching machine-wide one if a private one is not found.

Issues.Title: Support Inherited Form item and Inherited User Control items
Issues.Body:
OS: RS4 + .Net 4.8 03239.00  

Steps to reproduce:

1. Install .NET Core 3.0 SDK alpha available in the dotnet/code-sdk repo.
2. Create a new WinForms .NET Core 3.0 app using the CML:
```cmd
dotnet new winforms -o MyWinFormsApp
```
3. Open the .csproj file from the app folder using Visual Studio.
4. Build the app, then add the Inherited Form/Inherited User Control items to the project.

Actual:
An error pops up, click OK then the warning dialog pops up.

Unable to load assembly '\\mlangfs1\public\Winforms\NETCore30\BugReproApps\InheritedIssue\obj\Debug\netcoreapp3.0\InheritedIssue.dll'.  Ensure that the file is a valid .Net Framework assembly.

OK  
 
Click OK button:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10677481/58997903-667eea00-87b3-11e9-8789-5782fb2ea94a.png)

Issues.Title: The CellParsing event of the datagridview can't be invoked when changing the value of the cell firstly
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: (3.0.100-preview6-12253 from release branch)
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

**More info:**
The issue also can reproduce on the 3.0.100-preview7-12261 from master branch.

**Repro Steps:**

1.	Build and run the attached application.
[test1.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/3256911/test1.zip)
2.	Try to change the first cell value from “1” to “a1”.
3.	Click another cell using mouse.
4.	Repeat the step2 & step3.

**Actually Results:**
After step3:  The CellParsing event of the datagridview didn't invoke, and the value still is “1”,not be changed to “a1”.
After step4: The CellParsing event of the datagridview can be invoked, and the value was changed to “a1”.
![ReproSteps2 gif](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38325459/58952832-638df480-87c7-11e9-8099-5e6c5030e77a.gif)

**Expected:**
After step3:
The CellParsing event of the datagridview can be invoked, and the value was changed to “a1”.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The CellParsing event of the datagridview can't be invoked when changing the value of the cell firstly" (#1098)

Issues.Title: Winforms-When added the option(button) in panel not shown the option with DPIAwaresness in 4.7.2 .NET framework
Issues.Body:
**Describe the bug**
Control size and alignment is not proper in the panel with DPI awareness in 4.7.2 framework, but working fine in all other .NET frameworks.

```xml
XML code:
<System.Windows.Forms.ApplicationConfigurationSection>
    <add key="DpiAwareness" value="PerMonitorV2"/>    
  </System.Windows.Forms.ApplicationConfigurationSection>
```
**Sample**
[FrameWorkPanel.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/3250834/FrameWorkPanel.zip)

**Steps to reproduce the bug**
1.Run the Sample.
2.Click the button in the form.

**Observed**
Button is not properly added and aligned. Button text is not shown.

**Screenshots**
![FrameWork_4 7 2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44993310/58794252-63e68e00-8615-11e9-8578-83c8e45bfe8c.png)

**Expected**
Button should be properly aligned as below.

**Screenshots**
![FrameWork_4 6](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44993310/58797033-84661680-861c-11e9-9ec9-7988420aef29.png)

**Additional context**
Attached the Same sample  shown the option properly when framework as 4.6
This cases reproduced 4.7.2 frame work only.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Winforms-When added the option(button) in panel not shown the option with DPIAwaresness in 4.7.2 .NET framework" (#1085)
